questions.question: What is the primary reason for transitioning from IPv4 to IPv6?
How many bits are in an IPv6 address?
Which migration technique allows devices to run both IPv4 and IPv6 simultaneously?
What method transports IPv6 packets over IPv4 networks by encapsulating them?
Which technology allows IPv6-enabled devices to communicate with IPv4-enabled devices?
In IPv6 address representation, what is the term for a segment of 16 bits?
Which rule allows omitting leading zeros in IPv6 address notation?
What does the double colon (::) represent in IPv6 addressing?
How many times can the double colon be used in a single IPv6 address?
Which IPv6 address type is used to send a packet to multiple destinations?
What is the main characteristic of an anycast address?
options: Routes packets to the nearest device with that address

questions.question: Which statement about IPv6 broadcast addresses is correct?
options: IPv6 uses the same broadcast address as IPv4
IPv6 has a dedicated broadcast address type
IPv6 does not have broadcast addresses
IPv6 broadcast addresses start with FF00::

questions.question: What is the recommended prefix length for most IPv6 networks?
How many bits are typically used for the Interface ID in IPv6 addressing?
Which IPv6 address type is similar to public IPv4 addresses?
What is the primary purpose of a link-local address in IPv6?
options: Communication with devices on the same local link

questions.question: Which address range is used for IPv6 link-local addresses?
What is a key difference between IPv6 unique local addresses and IPv4 private addresses?
options: ULAs are not intended for security through obscurity
ULAs can only be used on point-to-point links

questions.question: Which field in a global unicast address identifies subnets within an organization?
What is the current range of assigned global unicast addresses?
Which command configures a global unicast address on a Cisco router interface?
What is the best practice for configuring the default gateway on IPv6 hosts?
options: Use the global unicast address of the router
Use the link-local address of the router
Use the unique local address of the router
Use the multicast address of the router

questions.question: Which protocol provides feedback about issues related to IP packet processing?
What are the ICMP message types common to both ICMPv4 and ICMPv6?
options: Host reachability, Destination unreachable, Time exceeded

questions.question: Which ICMP message tests the reachability of a host?
What does an ICMP Destination Unreachable message indicate?
options: The packet took too long to arrive
A destination or service is not reachable

questions.question: Which field determines when an ICMPv6 Time Exceeded message is generated?
What is the primary purpose of ICMPv6 Router Solicitation messages?
How often do IPv6 routers typically send Router Advertisement messages?
What information can a Router Advertisement message include?
options: Prefix, prefix length, DNS address, domain name
Subnet mask, broadcast address, WINS server
TTL value, protocol type, port number

questions.question: Which ICMPv6 message is used for duplicate address detection?
What is the purpose of Neighbor Solicitation messages in ICMPv6?
options: To locate routers on the network
To resolve IPv6 addresses to MAC addresses

questions.question: Which utility uses ICMP echo request and echo reply messages?
What does pinging the loopback address test?
options: Network connectivity to the default gateway
The internal IP configuration of the local host

questions.question: What is the IPv6 loopback address?
Why might the first ping to a destination timeout?
options: The destination is always slow to respond
Address resolution needs to be performed first
ICMP messages are blocked by default
The TTL value is set too low

questions.question: What does a successful ping to the default gateway indicate?
options: The host and router interface are operational on the local network

questions.question: Why might a ping to a remote host fail even if connectivity exists?
options: ICMP messages might be blocked by security restrictions
The remote host doesn't support IPv6

questions.question: What information does the traceroute utility provide?
options: The MAC addresses of all devices in the path
A list of hops and round-trip times between hosts
The bandwidth capacity of each link
The protocol used by each router

questions.question: What does an asterisk (*) indicate in traceroute output?
How does traceroute determine the path to a destination?
options: By sending packets with increasing TTL values
By querying DNS for path information

questions.question: What is the initial TTL value used by traceroute?
Which ICMP message does traceroute rely on?
What is Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC)?
Which component of NDP replaces ARP in IPv6?
What is the purpose of Duplicate Address Detection in IPv6?
options: To find the fastest path to a destination
To ensure IPv6 addresses are unique on the network
To detect duplicate routers on the same network

questions.question: Which IPv6 address type is confined to a single link and not routable?
What is the main advantage of IPv6's larger address space?
Which IPv6 transition method is considered the long-term goal?
What does the 'link-local' keyword do in Cisco IOS IPv6 configuration?
options: Specifies that the address is a link-local address
Configures the interface for local routing only

questions.question: Why is it recommended to use different link-local addresses on each router interface?
options: To make the router and interface easier to identify

questions.question: What is the primary function of ICMPv6 Redirect messages?
options: To inform hosts of a better first-hop router

questions.question: Which field in IPv6 is equivalent to the IPv4 TTL field?
What is the purpose of the IPv6 solicited-node multicast address?
Which statement about IPv6 address assignment is correct?
options: All-zeros and all-ones addresses cannot be used
Only all-zeros addresses can be assigned to devices
All-zeros and all-ones addresses can be assigned to devices
Only all-ones addresses can be assigned to devices

questions.question: What is the main difference between ICMPv4 and ICMPv6?
options: ICMPv6 includes additional functionality like neighbor discovery
ICMPv4 is more reliable than ICMPv6
ICMPv6 cannot test connectivity like ICMPv4
